questions.stem: Which of the following represents the lattice structure of A<sub>0.95</sub>O containing A<sup>2+</sup>, A<sup>3+</sup> and O<sup>2–</sup> ions?
questions.explanation: In metal deficiency defect, 3 A<sup>2+</sup> ions are replaced by 2 A<sup>3+</sup> ions, creating one cation vacancy per pair of A<sup>3+</sup> ions to maintain electrical neutrality. Structure A correctly shows this cation vacancy pattern.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The correct representation in six membered pyranose form for the given sugar [X] is: CHO | HO-H | H-OH | H-OH | CH₂OH

options.text: Haworth structure with OH groups at positions 1,2,3 axial
Haworth structure with OH groups at positions 1,2 axial and 3 equatorial
Haworth structure with all OH groups equatorial
Haworth structure with OH groups at positions 1,3 axial and 2 equatorial

questions.explanation: The given sugar is D-mannose. In its pyranose form, the Haworth projection shows the anomeric OH at C1 in α-position (axial), OH at C2 axial, and OH at C3 equatorial, which matches structure B.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Highest oxidation state of Mn is exhibited in Mn₂O₇. The correct statements about Mn₂O₇ are: (A) Mn is tetrahedrally surrounded by oxygen atoms (B) Mn is octahedrally surrounded by oxygen atoms (C) Contains Mn-O-Mn bridge (D) Contains Mn-Mn bond
questions.explanation: In Mn₂O₇, each Mn atom is in +7 oxidation state and is tetrahedrally surrounded by oxygen atoms. The structure contains Mn-O-Mn bridges but no direct Mn-Mn bond.
questions.tip_formula: Mn₂O₇ structure: Tetrahedral MnO₄ units connected by Mn-O-Mn bridges
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Decreasing order of dehydration of the following alcohols is: (a) 1° alcohol (b) 2° alcohol with conjugation (c) 3° alcohol (d) 2° alcohol without conjugation
questions.explanation: Dehydration rate depends on carbocation stability. The 2° alcohol with conjugation (b) forms the most stable carbocation due to resonance. Next is 2° alcohol without conjugation (d), then 3° alcohol (c), and finally 1° alcohol (a) forms the least stable carbocation.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Assertion A: Amongst He, Ne, Ar and Kr; 1 g of activated charcoal adsorbs more of Kr. Reason R: The critical volume Vc (cm³ mol⁻¹) and critical pressure Pc (atm) is highest for Krypton but the compressibility factor at critical point Zc is lowest for Krypton.

options.text: A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true
Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A

questions.explanation: Assertion A is true because adsorption increases with molecular weight due to stronger van der Waals forces. Kr has highest molecular weight among given noble gases. Reason R is false because Zc = 3/8 for all real gases at critical point.
questions.tip_formula: Adsorption ∝ Molecular weight; Zc = 3/8 for all real gases
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: In the following reaction, 'A' is: NH₂-CH₂-OH + EtO-C(=O)-C(=O)-OEt → A (Major product)
questions.explanation: The reaction involves nucleophilic attack by NH₂ group on carbonyl carbon, followed by intramolecular cyclization with the OH group, forming a stable cyclic imide structure.
questions.tip_formula: Intramolecular cyclization: NH₂ and OH groups react with dicarbonyl compound
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Match List I with List II: (A) Tranquilizers (B) Aspirin (C) Antibiotic (D) Antiseptic with (I) Anti blood clotting (II) Salvarsan (III) Antidepressant drugs (IV) Soframicine
questions.explanation: Tranquilizers are antidepressant drugs (III), Aspirin prevents blood clotting (I), Salvarsan is an antibiotic (II), and Soframicine is an antiseptic (IV).
questions.tip_formula: Drug classification: Tranquilizers→Antidepressant, Aspirin→Anticoagulant, Salvarsan→Antibiotic, Soframicine→Antiseptic
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Statement I: Chlorine can easily combine with oxygen to form oxides and the product has a tendency to explode. Statement II: Chemical reactivity of an element can be determined by its reaction with oxygen and halogens.

options.text: Both the statements I and II are true
Statement I is true but Statement II is false
Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Both the Statements I and II are false

questions.explanation: Statement I is true - chlorine oxides (Cl₂O, ClO₂, Cl₂O₆, Cl₂O₇) are highly reactive and explosive. Statement II is true - reaction with oxygen and halogens is a standard method to determine chemical reactivity of elements.
questions.tip_formula: Chlorine oxides: Cl₂O, ClO₂, Cl₂O₆, Cl₂O₇ - all explosive
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Resonance in carbonate ion (CO₃²⁻) is represented by three structures. Which of the following is true?

options.text: It is possible to identify each structure individually
All these structures are in dynamic equilibrium
Each structure exists for equal amount of time
CO₃²⁻ has a single structure i.e., resonance hybrid

questions.explanation: Resonance structures are hypothetical, and the real structure is the resonance hybrid which is a weighted average of all contributing structures. The carbonate ion has a single, delocalized structure with bond lengths intermediate between single and double bonds.
questions.tip_formula: Resonance hybrid = Weighted average of all resonating structures
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Identify the incorrect option from the following reactions:
questions.explanation: Option B is incorrect because alcoholic KOH promotes elimination reactions (formation of alkynes from vicinal dihalides or dehydrohalogenation), not substitution to form phenols. Aqueous KOH is used for nucleophilic substitution to form phenols.
questions.subject: Chemistry
